title: white on orange "Eingang" sign
content:
Anyone know this one?

thanx.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Picture%201.jpg) | 33.59 KB |
author: gngusmao

comments.content:
This looks like it might have been designed by Erik Spiekermann. Here are a few families that will get you close:

Officina Sans has a serifs/crossbars on the I and similar Gs:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-officina-sans/officinasanitc-extrabold/testdrive.html?s=EINGANG&p=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123005139/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-officina-sans/officinasanitc-extrabold/testdrive.html?s=EINGANG&p=48)

FF Fago Office Sans is also similar:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/fago-office-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=EINGANG&p=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123005139/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/fago-office-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=EINGANG&p=48)

Or try FF Unit Office:

[http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11049.5.15&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=EINGANG&sampleSize=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123005139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11049.5.15&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=EINGANG&sampleSize=48)
unfortunately ti’s not officina. the G i’m looking for has a different top ending.

You could also look at Auto 1, Ubik and Onuava  
Tim
